name: Nightmare Arena
description:
This is my second attempt at making a series of free, short RPGs that I call "Side Quests."

So basically, you play as someone who is sort of like a cop, but not really. Sort of like a bug tester... But not really. She's like... Sort of like, cyber crime division? Cyber terrorism division? But not quite. The agency (not mentioned in game) has investigated a string of deadly accidents happening within the Virtual Reality world. So, her job (your job) is to enter the Arena and find the "Shift Zone," a place in the virtual world where things are broken down and exposed - typically where hackers do their thing. The stakes here are, if she (you) doesn't find the Shift Zone... Everyone in the arena will die in real life.

So, shifting into the virtual world, you must take on the arena, train by fighting arena monsters and other arena combatants to level your character and conquer the arena. Be the Arena Victor, earn the Arena Card so you can move on to stronger arenas (not in game) and finally put a stop the cyber terrorists.

During the game you will be exploring a small park (Ossein Park Arena, basically Bone Park Arena but you can probably guess why I didn't want to call it that...) of darkness and death. By fighting other Arena Challengers you get Voltage (money) and one of their skills. By end game you will have a skill form every other challenger in your arsenal. 

You have 3 weapons and 3 armor sets to choose from, which you get from the equipment guys. Each has their own little strengths and weaknesses and each comes with their own skill. For example, one weapon may come with a skill that is powered by both Focus (magic) Attack and Agility, while another weapon may come with a skill that is only powered by Agility. So then you must decide how to build your character depending on what skills you want. But beware, when you invest in one skill, the others will fall far behind (unless you spend more time becoming balanced, which takes longer). 

You will be facing an onslaught of Arena Monsters which will keep coming at you (they respawn after 1 minute on field, it resets if you leave and come back). So between these monsters and the challengers, you will always have something to fight and strengthen yourself against. 

So can you do it? Can you both be the Arena Victor and put a stop to the threat of the Cyber Terrorists?
